{"step_by_step_thinking": "Odd-chain fatty acids have an odd number of carbon atoms. During β-oxidation, the fatty acid is broken down into two-carbon units called acetyl CoA. However, in the case of odd-chain fatty acids, the last round of β-oxidation produces a three-carbon unit called propionyl CoA. This propionyl CoA can then be converted into succinyl CoA through a series of enzymatic reactions. Therefore, the correct answer is B. Propionyl CoA.", "answer_choice": "B"}
